html:
Dec 8 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories on the New York Times business pages. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.


- Laboratory experiments from Africa Health Research Institute in South Africa found that Omicron seems to dull the power of the Pfizer Inc PFE.N and BioNTech's 22UAy.DE covid-19 vaccine, but also hinted that people who have received a booster shot might be better protected. https://nyti.ms/3ECzwwz


- Amazon AMZN.O warehouses around the U.S. stopped operating Tuesday as outages in the company's cloud computing system took down the technology that powers the company's logistics operations. https://nyti.ms/3DE80xj


- Stellantis STLA.MI said on Tuesday that it planned to spend 30 billion euros ($34 billion) through 2025 to develop new vehicles based on software that will let the company sell entertainment, navigation and other subscription services to buyers of its cars and trucks. https://nyti.ms/3dxZhCi


- Saule Omarova, a Cornell Law School professor whom critics painted as a communist after President Biden picked her for a key banking regulator job, withdrew from consideration for the post on Tuesday. https://nyti.ms/3dsSVUQ


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))
